meanings.definition: Choose or select (someone) to hold a public office or some other position by voting.
meanings.sent1: The class elects a new student council president every year.
meanings.sent2: The committee elects a chairperson through a democratic process.
meanings.sent3: In the land of make-believe, the toys elect a brave teddy bear as their leader.
meanings.sent4: The wise old tree elects the tiny squirrel as its guardian of secrets.
meanings.sent5: The shining star elects the brightest comet to accompany it on its journey through the night sky.

meanings.definition: To make a choice from a number of alternatives.
meanings.sent1: She elects to have an apple instead of a banana for a snack.
meanings.sent2: He elects to take the scenic route rather than the highway.
meanings.sent3: The cat elects to nap in the sunbeam rather than chase the butterfly.
meanings.sent4: The river elects to flow gently around the rocks in its path.
meanings.sent5: The child elects to wear the red shoes instead of the blue ones to the party.
